meanings.definition: To offend or insult someone openly
meanings.sent1: She was affronting her friend by making fun of her in front of everyone.
meanings.sent2: He didn't realize he was affronting her with his thoughtless comment.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's affronting jokes made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: His behavior was affronting to the principles of respect and kindness.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti on the wall was affronting to the entire neighborhood.

meanings.definition: An action or remark that causes offense or insult
meanings.sent1: The letter he received was an affronting to his beliefs.
meanings.sent2: She considered his words an affronting to her reputation.
meanings.sent3: The cake with the misspelled name was an affronting to the birthday girl.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti on the wall was an affronting to the community's values.
meanings.sent5: The rude gesture was an affronting to the peaceful atmosphere of the park.
